com.adobe.cq.social.graph.client.api

Class AbstractFollowing

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.adobe.cq.social.scf.core.BaseSocialComponent
      • com.adobe.cq.social.graph.client.api.AbstractFollowing
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Following, MutableFollowing, SocialComponent

    public class AbstractFollowing
extends BaseSocialComponent
implements MutableFollowing
    Base class of SCF Following component. A Following represents a relationship between two users. The value of the userId and the followedId is obtained in the following order: If the request is a Post request, then the userId and the followedId are obtained from the request parameters. If the request is a Get request, then:

    1. The userId is obtained from the resource Following.PROP_USERID property; If this property does not exist, the userId is obtained from the request's session user id.

    2. The followedId is obtained from the resource Following.PROP_FOLLOWEDID property; If this property does not exist, the userId is obtained from the resource name
